titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Citizens' League for Effective City Government records 1964-1966
Citizens' League for Effective City Government records

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-03-12.

langusage.language: Finding aid is written in English.

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.unittitle: Citizens' League for Effective City Government records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Citizens' League for Effective City Government (Portland, Or.)

did.abstract: Collection of records related to a committee formed to change Portland city government from a commission to mayor-council form. The collection is unprocessed; it includes minutes, member notices, mailing lists, press releases, correspondence, financial records, campaign materials and scrapbooks, 1964-1966.

bioghist.p: The Citizens' League for Effective City Government was a committee formed to change Portland city government from commission to mayor-council form and to place a revised charter measure on the May 1966 ballot.

odd.p: This collection is unprocessed. Contact library staff for assistance.

prefercite.p: Citizens' League for Effective City Government records, Mss 1150, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes minutes, member notices, mailing lists, press releases, correspondence, financial records, campaign materials and two scrapbooks, 1964-1966.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society owns the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from copyright owners.
